page.title: 10Gardening in Stratton
page.content: The chalk subsoil means that acid loving plants do not flourish in Stratton. Nevertheless the general run of garden flowers and vegetables are successful. Grapes flourish out of doors as do peaches and apricots on sheltered walls. A number of the larger houses have hens. Home bread baking and wine making are popular, as is evident in the annual show. Two households keep sheep in order to spin wool, and there are several bee hives. The farmworkers no longer have a strip of a field planted with potatoes for their own consumption. The allotments have disappeared. The new houses have tiny gardens incapable of holding more than a few potted plants. The traditional produce show is in dasnger of extinction.There are few large trees, but hedges along the road give a pleasant green impression.
